title: whohub
content:
has anyone ever heard anything about a website called “whohub.net”?

i received an email from them asking for an interview, and i was wondering if they were legit.

 [‹ what th???!!! {PG-13}](http://web.archive.org/web/20090331082506/http:/typophile.com/node/17129 "Go to previous forum topic") [Extended unicode font for publication ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090331082506/http:/typophile.com/node/51534 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ChuckGroth

comments.content:
Look at the whois:

“  
Registrant:  
F.S.O.  
195 St  
Miami , Florida 33179  
United States

Administrative Contact:  
F.S.O.  
195 St  
Miami , Florida 33179  
United States  
 [fran@jerni.com](mailto:fran@jerni.com)  
+01 0000000000

Technical Contact:  
F.S.O.  
195 St  
Miami , Florida 33179  
United States  
 [fran@jerni.com](mailto:fran@jerni.com)  
+01 0000000000

Record expires on 2009/08/23 UTC  
Record created on 2008/08/23 UTC  
“

Strike 1: it’s in Florida - scam central.  
Strike 2: “195 St” isn’t a valid address.  
Strike 3: jerni.com doesn’t come up, and its own whois is suspicious.

And to top it off: the creation date is two days in the future...

hhp

You’re right on all counts, hrant.  
That was the feeling I got from the email, but i wanted to see if anyone else had even heard of them.
I received a mail from them, too, and I wanted to check them out more. This is my first place to research them. From what I see above, I think I shall pass up this “one time offer!” Thanks!
